energy: Steam system optimisation in dyeing and finishing operations to reduce thermal energy consumption
Heat recovery from process wastewater in wet processing departments
Installation of variable-frequency drives on spinning, weaving, and knitting machinery
LED lighting retrofit across production floors and cutting rooms
Scheduled equipment shutdown protocols during non-production hours
emissions: Monthly monitoring of boiler fuel consumption for steam generation
Evaluation of biomass or solar thermal for process heating
Quarterly GHG inventory covering Scope 1 (boilers, vehicles) and Scope 2 (grid electricity)
Transition from heavy fuel oil to natural gas for steam generation
Participation in industry decarbonisation initiatives (e.g., Fashion Industry Charter for Climate Action)
waste: Fabric cutting waste minimisation through marker optimisation and nesting software
Textile waste segregation: fabric offcuts, yarn waste, packaging, hazardous chemicals
Partnership with textile recyclers for pre-consumer fabric waste recovery
Chemical container return and refill programmes with dye and chemical suppliers
Yarn and fibre waste collection for recycling into lower-grade products
water: Wastewater treatment plant for process effluent from dyeing and finishing
Water recycling and reuse in rinsing and washing stages of wet processing
Water metering at major process points: dyeing, washing, finishing, boiler feed
Adoption of low-liquor-ratio dyeing equipment to reduce water consumption per kg fabric
Compliance with ZDHC Manufacturing Restricted Substances List (MRSL) for wastewater discharge

health_safety: Chemical handling and storage protocols compliant with GHS labelling requirements
Ventilation and dust extraction systems in spinning, carding, and cutting areas
Heat stress prevention measures in dyeing and finishing departments
Machine guarding and needle guard protocols on sewing and knitting equipment
Emergency response procedures including chemical spill containment and fire evacuation
Regular noise monitoring and hearing protection programmes in weaving areas
Ergonomic assessments for repetitive-task roles in garment assembly
training: New-starter induction covering chemical safety, machine operation, and fire procedures
Annual refresher training on chemical handling and SDS interpretation
Skills development and cross-training programmes for production operatives
Supervisor training on fair labour practices and grievance handling
First-aid and fire warden training for designated staff per shift
labor_practices: Working hours tracking and overtime management compliant with local labour law and buyer codes
Fair wage practices benchmarked against living wage standards
Freedom of association and worker representation mechanisms
No child labour and age verification procedures during recruitment
Grievance mechanism accessible to all workers including migrant and contract staff

governance: Anti-bribery and corruption awareness integrated into management onboarding
Conflict-of-interest declaration required from sourcing and procurement staff
Confidential whistleblowing channel for reporting ethical and labour concerns
Data protection measures for worker personal information and buyer data
Annual management review of compliance with buyer codes of conduct

procurement: Raw material traceability for cotton, polyester, and other key fibres
Supplier qualification including social audit and environmental compliance review
Preference for certified raw materials (GOTS, OEKO-TEX, BCI, GRS)
Periodic supplier audits covering labour conditions, environmental practices, and chemical management
Conflict minerals and responsible sourcing due diligence for metal components (zippers, buttons)
Chemical supplier evaluation against ZDHC MRSL conformance

ENVIRONMENT.vision: committed to minimising the environmental impact of our textile manufacturing operations, with a focus on water stewardship, chemical management, and energy efficiency
ENVIRONMENT.formal: Our Environmental Policy, endorsed by senior management, establishes our commitment to responsible water use, wastewater treatment, chemical management aligned with ZDHC standards, and compliance with applicable environmental legislation
ENVIRONMENT.informal: Environmental stewardship is embedded in our daily operations through wastewater treatment, chemical management procedures, energy monitoring, and fabric waste recovery programmes
ENVIRONMENT.roadmap: We are developing a formalised Environmental Policy for publication in {year}, building on our existing water treatment, chemical management, and energy monitoring practices

LABOR.vision: committed to providing safe, fair, and dignified working conditions for all employees across our textile operations
LABOR.formal: Our Health, Safety & Labour Policy, aligned with international standards and buyer codes of conduct, establishes our commitment to worker safety, fair wages, reasonable working hours, and freedom of association
LABOR.informal: Worker welfare is managed through established protocols including chemical safety training, working hours tracking, fair wage practices, and accessible grievance mechanisms
LABOR.roadmap: We are formalising our labour and safety management approach into a documented policy for {year}, aligning with ILO conventions, SA8000 principles, and key buyer requirements

ETHICS.vision: committed to conducting business with integrity, transparency, and respect for workers, communities, and business partners
ETHICS.formal: Our Code of Business Conduct outlines expectations for ethical behaviour, anti-corruption, and compliance, applicable to all employees and business partners throughout the supply chain
ETHICS.informal: Ethical business conduct expectations are communicated through employee onboarding, reinforced through line management, and monitored through buyer audit programmes
ETHICS.roadmap: We are developing a formal Code of Conduct for {year}, consolidating our existing ethics expectations and buyer compliance requirements into a single documented framework

SUPPLY_CHAIN.vision: committed to responsible sourcing, fibre traceability, and maintaining ethical and environmental standards throughout our textile supply chain
SUPPLY_CHAIN.formal: Our Supplier Code of Conduct establishes minimum expectations for environmental management, labour conditions, chemical safety, and ethical practices for all raw material and component suppliers
SUPPLY_CHAIN.informal: Supply chain management is conducted through supplier audits, raw material traceability efforts, and preference for certified inputs including GOTS and OEKO-TEX certified materials
SUPPLY_CHAIN.roadmap: We are developing a formal Supplier Code of Conduct for {year}, extending our existing quality and compliance-based supplier management to include comprehensive ESG criteria and fibre traceability requirements
